data.content:
Pantheon (Ruthless Pantheon)

RP Cost: 975 RP

Release Date: November 29, 2011

League of Legends is known for its vast array of champions, each with their own unique abilities and playstyles. One such champion is Pantheon, a fearsome warrior hailing from the ancient city-state of Targon. Pantheon is a versatile champion who excels in the top lane and jungle roles, and his ruthless nature is perfectly captured in his

skin.

The

skin was released on November 29, 2011, and has since become a popular choice among Pantheon players. This skin transforms Pantheon into a menacing figure, clad in dark armor with glowing red accents. The skin features intricate details, such as the etchings on his armor and the menacing spikes on his shoulder pads. With this skin, Pantheon truly embodies the ruthless warrior he is known to be.

But what is the story behind this fearsome costume? In the lore of League of Legends, Pantheon is a member of the Rakkor, a tribe of warrior-philosophers who reside on Mount Targon. The Rakkor are chosen by the celestial aspect known as the Pantheon, who grants them incredible strength and skill in battle. Pantheon himself is a paragon of the Rakkor, revered for his unwavering determination and unyielding resolve.

The

skin represents a darker side of Pantheon, a version of him that has fully embraced the ruthless nature of war. In this alternate universe, Pantheon has forsaken his role as a protector and has become a merciless warrior, seeking only to conquer and destroy. The skin reflects this transformation, with its dark color scheme and aggressive design.

When playing as

players can experience the thrill of embodying this ruthless warrior. Pantheon's abilities take on a more menacing appearance, with his spear glowing with an eerie red energy. His ultimate ability, Grand Skyfall, sees him descending from the heavens with a fiery impact, leaving a trail of destruction in his wake. With this skin, players can truly feel the power and ferocity of Pantheon as they dominate the battlefield.

Now, let's delve into Pantheon's story within the game itself. Pantheon is a champion who excels in the early game, known for his strong laning presence and ability to snowball leads. His passive ability, Aegis Protection, allows him to block a basic attack every few seconds, making him a formidable duelist. His Q ability, Spear Shot, allows him to poke enemies from a distance, while his W ability, Aegis Assault, allows him to leap onto enemies and unleash a flurry of powerful strikes.

Pantheon's E ability, Heartseeker Strike, is a devastating area-of-effect ability that deals damage to all enemies in a cone in front of him. This ability is particularly effective when combined with his W ability, as it allows him to quickly burst down enemies in close quarters combat. Finally, Pantheon's ultimate ability, Grand Skyfall, is a global ability that allows him to leap into the air and land at a target location, dealing damage to all enemies in the area upon impact.

While Pantheon is a formidable champion in the early game, he does have his weaknesses. As the game progresses, Pantheon's damage falls off, and he becomes more reliant on his team to secure victories. Additionally, Pantheon is a melee champion, which makes him vulnerable to ranged champions who can poke him from a distance. It is important for Pantheon players to capitalize on their early game strength and secure objectives to maintain their advantage.

In the world of League of Legends, Pantheon has become a staple pick in the top lane and jungle roles. His ability to dominate the early game and snowball leads makes him a popular choice among aggressive players. Pantheon's versatility allows him to fit into a variety of team compositions, and his ability to initiate fights with his ultimate ability makes him a valuable asset in teamfights.

On this page, you can find information and videos about all of Pantheon's appearances, including the
skin. Whether you prefer the ruthless warrior or the honorable protector, Pantheon offers a thrilling gameplay experience that is sure to keep you on the edge of your seat.

Pantheon (Dragonslayer Pantheon)

RP Cost: 1350 RP

Release Date: March 5, 2020

Dragonslayer Pantheon is a fearsome skin that transforms the already formidable Pantheon into a dragon-slaying warrior. Released on March 5, 2020, this skin is part of the Dragonslayer skin line, which features champions who have dedicated themselves to hunting down and vanquishing the mighty dragons that roam the world of League of Legends.

As a Dragonslayer, Pantheon dons a suit of armor adorned with dragon motifs, showcasing his commitment to his cause. His spear is replaced with a dragon-themed weapon, and his abilities are enhanced with fiery effects, symbolizing his prowess in battle against these mythical creatures.

The Dragonslayer Pantheon skin offers a visually stunning experience for players, immersing them in the world of dragon-slaying and adding a touch of epicness to their gameplay. With its intricate details and fiery effects, this skin truly captures the essence of Pantheon's role as a Dragonslayer.

Pantheon: The Artisan of War

Pantheon, also known as the Artisan of War, is a powerful champion in League of Legends. He is a melee fighter who excels in dealing burst damage and engaging in team fights. With his spear and shield, Pantheon is a formidable force on the battlefield, capable of taking down enemies with precision and skill.

Originally hailing from the war-torn nation of Targon, Pantheon is a warrior who fights for justice and honor. He is a member of the Rakkor, a tribe of fierce warriors who worship the sun and seek to protect their homeland from any threats. Pantheon embodies the ideals of his tribe, dedicating himself to the pursuit of victory and the defense of his people.

In the game, Pantheon's abilities reflect his warrior nature. His passive ability, Mortal Will, empowers his next basic attack after using an ability, allowing him to deal additional damage. His Q ability, Spear Shot, allows him to throw his spear at a target, dealing damage and applying a critical hit if the target is below a certain health threshold. His W ability, Aegis Assault, allows him to leap to a target and strike them with his shield, stunning them and blocking incoming damage. His E ability, Heartseeker Strike, unleashes a flurry of spear strikes in a cone, damaging all enemies in its path. Finally, his ultimate ability, Grand Starfall, allows him to leap into the air and crash down at a target location, damaging and slowing enemies in the area.

Pantheon's strengths lie in his ability to engage in fights and burst down enemies quickly. His combination of mobility, crowd control, and damage makes him a formidable threat in both solo and team fights. However, he is relatively squishy and lacks sustained damage, making him vulnerable to champions who can outlast his burst and wear him down over time.

Throughout his journey in League of Legends, Pantheon has undergone several changes and updates to his abilities and gameplay. These changes have aimed to balance his power and make him a more viable pick in the game's ever-evolving meta. As a result, Pantheon has remained a popular choice for players who enjoy a high-impact playstyle and the thrill of engaging in intense battles.

On this page, you can find information and videos showcasing all the appearances of Pantheon, including the Dragonslayer Pantheon skin. Whether you're a fan of his classic look or want to explore the different skins available, this page is your go-to resource for all things Pantheon.

Pantheon (Myrmidon Pantheon)

RP Cost: 975 RP

Release Date: November 29, 2011

Myrmidon Pantheon is a skin for the champion Pantheon in the popular online game League of Legends. This skin was released on November 29, 2011, and is available for purchase in the in-game store for 975 RP.

The Myrmidon Pantheon skin transforms the Spartan warrior into a fearsome and battle-hardened soldier. With its unique design and visual effects, this skin offers players a fresh and exciting way to experience Pantheon's gameplay.

As a legendary warrior, Pantheon is known for his exceptional combat skills and unwavering determination. The Myrmidon Pantheon skin perfectly captures his fierce and relentless nature, showcasing his prowess on the battlefield.

With this skin, Pantheon dons a set of intricately designed armor, adorned with sharp edges and intricate details. The armor is predominantly black, with gold accents that add a touch of elegance to the overall appearance. The helmet features a menacing faceplate, complete with glowing red eyes that strike fear into the hearts of his enemies.

One of the standout features of the Myrmidon Pantheon skin is the weapon he wields. Instead of his usual spear, Pantheon now wields a massive double-bladed axe. This weapon exudes power and brutality, reflecting Pantheon's relentless pursuit of victory on the battlefield.

In addition to the visual changes, the Myrmidon Pantheon skin also includes unique sound effects and animations. With every strike, players can hear the satisfying sound of metal clashing against metal, further immersing them in the intense combat experience. The animations are smooth and fluid, adding an extra layer of visual appeal to Pantheon's abilities.

Now, let's delve into the story of Pantheon and his place in the League of Legends universe. Pantheon, also known as Atreus, hails from the war-torn region of Targon. He is a proud and disciplined warrior who fights for justice and honor. Pantheon's unwavering dedication to his cause has earned him the title of

In the game, Pantheon is classified as a melee fighter and excels at engaging enemies head-on. His abilities revolve around dealing damage and disrupting his opponents. His passive ability, Mortal Will, empowers his next basic ability after using four basic attacks or abilities. This allows him to unleash devastating combos and surprise his enemies with burst damage.

Pantheon's Q ability, Spear Shot, allows him to throw his spear at a target, dealing damage and applying a brief slow. This ability is great for harassing enemies in the laning phase and finishing off low-health targets. His W ability, Aegis Assault, grants him a shield and allows him to leap to a target, stunning them and dealing damage in the process. This ability is perfect for engaging enemies or escaping dangerous situations.

His E ability, Heartseeker Strike, is an area-of-effect ability that deals damage to all enemies in a cone in front of him. This ability is excellent for wave-clearing and dealing damage to multiple enemies at once. Finally, his ultimate ability, Grand Skyfall, allows him to leap into the air and then crash down at a target location, dealing damage to all enemies in the area. This ability is a game-changer and can turn the tide of team fights when used strategically.

Pantheon's strengths lie in his early game dominance and ability to snowball. With his high burst damage and crowd control, he can quickly eliminate squishy targets and establish an advantage for his team. His ability to roam and impact other lanes with his ultimate also makes him a formidable presence on the map.

However, Pantheon does have weaknesses that players should be aware of. As the game progresses, Pantheon's damage output falls off, and he becomes more reliant on his team to secure kills. Additionally, his lack of mobility makes him vulnerable to crowd control and kiting. Skilled opponents can exploit these weaknesses and render Pantheon less effective in team fights.

In conclusion, the Myrmidon Pantheon skin offers players a visually stunning and immersive experience with the champion Pantheon. With its unique design, sound effects, and animations, this skin brings a fresh and exciting feel to the game. Whether you're a fan of Pantheon or simply looking for a new skin to add to your collection, Myrmidon Pantheon is a worthy addition.

For more information about Pantheon and his various appearances in League of Legends, including videos showcasing his abilities and skins, be sure to visit our dedicated page. Explore the world of Pantheon and unleash your inner warrior!

Pantheon (Default)

RP Cost: N/A

Release Date: N/A

Pantheon, the Artisan of War, is a formidable champion in the popular online game League of Legends. As one of the original champions, Pantheon has become an iconic figure in the game's lore and has received several skins over the years. However, his default skin remains the most recognizable and widely used by players.

The default skin for Pantheon showcases his classic appearance, embodying the essence of a Spartan warrior. He wears a bronze helmet adorned with a red plume, which symbolizes his unwavering determination and courage. His armor consists of a bronze chest plate, shoulder guards, and greaves, providing him with both protection and mobility on the battlefield. Pantheon wields a spear and a round shield, ready to engage in combat and defend his allies.

While the default skin may lack the flashy effects and unique visual elements of his alternate skins, it captures the essence of Pantheon's character and his role as a warrior. It represents his dedication to the art of war and his commitment to fighting for justice and honor.

Pantheon's Story

Pantheon's story within the League of Legends universe is one of tragedy and redemption. Once a mortal man named Atreus, he was chosen by the celestial Aspect of War, known as Atreus, to become his vessel. With the Aspect's power coursing through him, Atreus was reborn as Pantheon, the embodiment of war and battle.

Pantheon's past is shrouded in mystery, but it is known that he hails from the war-torn region of Targon. He fought alongside his fellow Rakkor warriors, defending their homeland from various threats. However, tragedy struck when the Aspect of War was slain during a battle against the Void. Pantheon, now the sole vessel of the Aspect's power, took up the mantle and became the new Aspect of War.

As the Aspect of War, Pantheon is driven by a singular purpose: to protect the mortal realm from any and all threats. He is a relentless warrior, always seeking out battles and challenges to prove his strength and honor. Pantheon's unwavering dedication to his cause has made him a revered figure among the Rakkor and a feared opponent on the battlefield.

Strengths and Weaknesses

Pantheon's kit is designed to excel in the early game, making him a dominant force in the top lane. His passive ability, Mortal Will, empowers his next basic ability after using four basic attacks or abilities, granting bonus effects and increased damage. This allows Pantheon to unleash devastating combos and quickly burst down his opponents.

His Q ability, Spear Shot, is a long-range skillshot that deals damage and applies a passive stack of Mortal Will. When empowered, it becomes Comet Spear, dealing increased damage and slowing the target. This ability allows Pantheon to poke his enemies from a safe distance and set up engages.

Pantheon's W ability, Aegis Assault, grants him a shield and allows him to leap to a target, stunning them and dealing damage. This ability is a powerful tool for engaging or disengaging fights, as it provides both crowd control and survivability.

His E ability, Heartseeker Strike, is an area-of-effect ability that deals damage in a cone in front of him. When empowered, it becomes Shield Vault, stunning all enemies hit. This ability is particularly effective in team fights, as it can disrupt multiple enemies and set up for follow-up damage.

Pantheon's ultimate ability, Grand Starfall, allows him to leap into the air and land at a target location, damaging and slowing all enemies in the area. This ability has a global range, making it a powerful tool for map-wide presence and surprise engages.

Despite his strengths, Pantheon does have weaknesses. He is heavily reliant on his early game dominance and can struggle in the late game if he falls behind. Additionally, his abilities have relatively high cooldowns, making him vulnerable during their downtime. Pantheon's lack of sustained damage also makes him less effective against tanky opponents.

Explore Pantheon's Appearances

If you're interested in exploring Pantheon's various appearances and skins, you can find more information and videos on our dedicated page. From the fiery Infernal skin to the cosmic-themed Cosmic Defender skin, Pantheon offers a wide range of visual options to suit every player's taste.

Whether you choose to stick with Pantheon's default skin or experiment with his alternate appearances, one thing is certain: Pantheon will always be a formidable force on the battlefield, ready to bring justice and honor to the League of Legends.

Pantheon (Baker Pantheon)

RP Cost: 1350 RP

Release Date: April 1, 2022

League of Legends is known for its diverse range of champions and their unique skins. One such skin that adds a touch of humor and charm to the game is

This delightful skin transforms the mighty warrior Pantheon into a master baker, complete with a chef's hat, apron, and a rolling pin as his weapon of choice. Released on April 1, 2022, this skin brings a lighthearted twist to Pantheon's character, showcasing his culinary skills in the heat of battle.

The Baker Pantheon skin is priced at 1350 RP, making it a moderately priced skin that offers a significant visual overhaul for the champion. With its attention to detail and unique animations, this skin is a must-have for Pantheon enthusiasts and those looking to add a touch of whimsy to their League of Legends experience.

The Story of Baker Pantheon

The story behind the Baker Pantheon skin is as delightful as the skin itself. In the world of League of Legends, Pantheon is known as a fierce warrior, dedicated to protecting his homeland and fighting for justice. However, even the mightiest warriors need a break from battle, and that's where Baker Pantheon comes in.

In this alternate universe, Pantheon has discovered a passion for baking. When he's not defending his people, he can be found in his bakery, creating delicious treats for all to enjoy. With his trusty rolling pin in hand, he brings his culinary skills to the battlefield, using his baking prowess to defeat his enemies.

The Baker Pantheon skin showcases Pantheon's transformation into a master baker. His armor is replaced with a chef's apron, complete with pockets filled with baking tools. His helmet is replaced with a chef's hat, adorned with a golden emblem. Instead of his usual spear, Pantheon wields a giant rolling pin, ready to flatten his foes.

But it's not just Pantheon's appearance that changes with this skin. The Baker Pantheon skin also features unique animations and effects. When Pantheon uses his Q ability,
he throws a baguette at his enemies instead of a spear. His W ability,
is transformed into a powerful dough slam, and his E ability,
creates a circle of flour instead of a shield. Finally, his ultimate ability,

sees Pantheon descending from the sky with a giant cake, leaving a trail of confetti in his wake.

Pantheon: The Unbreakable Spear

Pantheon, the Artisan of War, is a formidable champion in the world of League of Legends. With his origins rooted in ancient Targon, Pantheon is a warrior who fights with unwavering determination and unbreakable resolve. Armed with his spear and shield, he charges into battle, ready to defend his people and strike down his enemies.

As a champion, Pantheon possesses a unique set of strengths and weaknesses. His strengths lie in his ability to engage and burst down enemies with his high damage output. His Q ability,
allows him to poke and harass opponents from a distance, while his W ability,
provides him with a powerful stun and burst damage. His E ability,

grants him a shield and allows him to block incoming damage, making him a formidable duelist.

However, Pantheon also has his weaknesses. He lacks sustained damage and can struggle against tanky opponents who can withstand his initial burst. Additionally, his abilities have relatively high cooldowns, making him vulnerable during the downtime between his rotations. Pantheon excels in the early game, where his high base damage can dominate opponents, but he can fall off in the late game if not properly snowballed.

In the world of League of Legends, Pantheon has a rich history. Originally released in 2010, Pantheon has undergone several changes and updates over the years to maintain balance and keep him relevant in the ever-evolving meta. He has been a popular pick in both professional play and solo queue, known for his early game dominance and ability to snowball a lead.

With the addition of the Baker Pantheon skin, players can now experience a lighter side of Pantheon's character. This skin adds a touch of humor and whimsy to the champion, showcasing his culinary skills and providing a refreshing twist to his traditional warrior persona.

On the Baker Pantheon page, players can find information and videos showcasing all of Pantheon's appearances in the game. From his classic skin to his various other skins, players can explore the different visual and thematic interpretations of this iconic champion.

Whether you're a fan of Pantheon's traditional warrior persona or looking to add a touch of humor to your League of Legends experience, the Baker Pantheon skin is a delightful addition to any collection. With its unique animations, charming design, and attention to detail, this skin brings a fresh and lighthearted twist to the world of Pantheon.

So, don your chef's hat, grab your rolling pin, and join Pantheon in the kitchen as he bakes his way to victory on the Fields of Justice!

Pantheon (Ruined Pantheon)

Cost: 1350 RP | Release Date: April 30, 2020

Pantheon, the Artisan of War, has received a haunting new skin in the form of

This skin, released on April 30, 2020, brings a dark and twisted version of Pantheon to the Fields of Justice. With its eerie aesthetic and unique animations, Ruined Pantheon is a must-have for fans of the champion.

The Ruined Pantheon skin transforms Pantheon into a corrupted version of himself, reflecting the dark forces that have consumed him. His armor is tattered and worn, covered in ominous runes and symbols. The once bright and shining spear has been replaced with a jagged, sinister weapon, dripping with an otherworldly energy.

One of the standout features of the Ruined Pantheon skin is the new visual effects. Pantheon's abilities have been reimagined to match the theme of corruption and decay. When he activates his ultimate ability, Grand Starfall, a trail of dark energy follows him as he descends upon his enemies. The ground cracks and crumbles beneath him, leaving a trail of destruction in his wake.

Furthermore, Ruined Pantheon's recall animation is a sight to behold. Pantheon is engulfed in a swirling vortex of darkness, as if being consumed by the very forces that have corrupted him. It's a chilling reminder of the power that now controls him.

Now, let's delve into the lore and story behind Pantheon and his Ruined Pantheon skin. Pantheon, once a mortal warrior named Atreus, was chosen by the celestial Aspect of War, known as Atreus, to become his vessel. With the Aspect's power, Pantheon fought valiantly in the name of justice and order. However, in the Ruined Pantheon skin, we witness a different fate for this champion.

In this alternate reality, Pantheon succumbs to the darkness that he once fought against. The Ruined Pantheon skin represents a corrupted version of the champion, where he has been consumed by the very forces he sought to vanquish. The once noble warrior is now a twisted and malevolent entity, driven by a thirst for destruction.

Despite his fall from grace, Pantheon still retains his incredible strength and combat prowess. His abilities remain as deadly as ever, allowing players to dominate the battlefield with his devastating attacks. Pantheon excels in close-quarters combat, utilizing his spear and shield to deal massive damage to his enemies.

One of Pantheon's key strengths is his ability to engage and initiate fights. With his ultimate ability, Grand Starfall, Pantheon can leap into the air and come crashing down on his enemies, stunning them and dealing significant damage. This makes him a formidable force in team fights, as he can quickly turn the tide in his team's favor.

However, Pantheon does have his weaknesses. He is primarily a melee champion, which means he is vulnerable to ranged opponents who can keep their distance. Additionally, Pantheon relies heavily on his abilities to deal damage, so if he is unable to land his skill shots, his effectiveness in combat diminishes.

In the world of League of Legends, Pantheon has a rich history. He was one of the original champions released when the game first launched in 2009. Over the years, Pantheon has undergone several changes and updates to his abilities and gameplay, ensuring that he remains a relevant and exciting champion to play.

Pantheon's place in the game is that of a versatile top laner or jungler. His kit allows him to excel in both roles, providing players with flexibility in their playstyle. Whether you prefer to dominate your lane or roam the map to secure objectives, Pantheon can adapt to various strategies and playstyles.

On this page, you can find information and videos showcasing all of Pantheon's appearances, including the Ruined Pantheon skin. Explore the different skins and discover the unique themes and visual effects that each one brings to the champion.

So, whether you're a fan of Pantheon's lore, a collector of skins, or simply looking for a new and exciting champion to play, Ruined Pantheon is a skin that should not be missed. Embrace the darkness and unleash your destructive power with this hauntingly beautiful skin.

Pantheon (Full Metal Pantheon)

RP Cost: 975 RP | Release Date: November 29, 2011

Pantheon, the Artisan of War, is a formidable champion in the popular online game League of Legends. With his iconic spear and shield, he embodies the spirit of a true warrior. Among his many skins, one stands out as a testament to his strength and resilience - Full Metal Pantheon.

Released on November 29, 2011, Full Metal Pantheon is a skin that transforms Pantheon into a metallic war machine. This skin is available for purchase in the in-game store for 975 RP. With its sleek design and futuristic aesthetic, Full Metal Pantheon offers players a unique and visually striking experience.

The Full Metal Pantheon skin features Pantheon clad in a suit of heavy armor, complete with metallic plating and glowing blue accents. His spear and shield are also given a metallic makeover, exuding power and dominance. The attention to detail in this skin is remarkable, with intricate textures and animations that bring the character to life.

One of the standout features of Full Metal Pantheon is the visual effects it brings to Pantheon's abilities. When using his Q ability, Spear Shot, Pantheon hurls a metallic spear at his enemies, leaving a trail of blue energy in its wake. His W ability, Aegis of Zeonia, showcases a stunning display of power as he leaps into the air, crashing down on his target with a burst of energy. The ultimate ability, Grand Skyfall, is also enhanced with Full Metal Pantheon, as he descends from the sky in a blaze of blue flames, striking fear into the hearts of his enemies.

Now, let's delve into the lore and story of Pantheon himself. Pantheon is a warrior from the war-torn region of Mount Targon, a place where only the strongest and most determined survive. He was once a mortal man named Atreus, who dedicated his life to the pursuit of martial excellence. Seeking to become the embodiment of war, Atreus climbed Mount Targon and challenged the celestial aspect known as Pantheon. In a fierce battle, Atreus emerged victorious, slaying the aspect and taking on its divine power.

With his newfound abilities, Pantheon became the embodiment of war, donning his iconic armor and spear. He fights not for personal glory, but to protect his people and uphold the ideals of justice and honor. Pantheon is a relentless warrior, always seeking out the next battle to prove his strength and skill.

In the world of League of Legends, Pantheon is known for his exceptional dueling capabilities and burst damage. His passive ability, Mortal Will, empowers his next basic attack after using an ability, allowing him to deal bonus damage. His Q ability, Spear Shot, allows him to poke and harass enemies from a distance, while his W ability, Aegis of Zeonia, enables him to stun and disable opponents in close combat. Pantheon's E ability, Heartseeker Strike, unleashes a flurry of strikes, dealing damage to all nearby enemies. Finally, his ultimate ability, Grand Skyfall, allows him to leap into the air and crash down on a targeted location, dealing massive damage and slowing enemies in the area.

While Pantheon excels in the early game with his strong laning presence and burst damage, he can struggle in the late game when tanks and crowd control become more prevalent. His lack of mobility and reliance on landing skill shots can make him vulnerable to coordinated team play. However, in the hands of a skilled player, Pantheon can be a force to be reckoned with, dominating the battlefield and leading his team to victory.

On this page, you can find information and videos showcasing all of Pantheon's appearances, including the Full Metal Pantheon skin. Whether you prefer the classic look or the futuristic appeal of Full Metal Pantheon, this champion offers a thrilling and engaging gameplay experience. So, gear up, summoner, and join the ranks of the Artisan of War!

Pantheon (Ashen Conqueror Pantheon)

RP Cost: 1350 RP

Release Date: August 1, 2014

Pantheon, the Artisan of War, is a fearsome warrior in the world of League of Legends. With his iconic spear and shield, he embodies the spirit of battle and conquest. One of his most striking appearances is the

skin, which transforms him into a formidable figure ready to conquer any battlefield.

The Ashen Conqueror Pantheon skin was released on August 1, 2014, and quickly became a favorite among Pantheon enthusiasts. Priced at 1350 RP, this skin offers a visually stunning and thematic transformation for the champion.

As the name suggests, Ashen Conqueror Pantheon presents a darker and more menacing version of the champion. His armor is adorned with intricate details, featuring a black and gold color scheme that exudes power and dominance. The skin also introduces new visual effects, including fiery particles and a unique recall animation.

One of the standout features of the Ashen Conqueror Pantheon skin is the imposing helmet that Pantheon wears. With its sharp edges and intimidating design, it adds an extra layer of intimidation to the champion's appearance. The helmet also features glowing eyes, giving Pantheon an otherworldly aura on the battlefield.

When it comes to gameplay, the Ashen Conqueror Pantheon skin does not offer any significant advantages or disadvantages. It is purely a cosmetic upgrade, allowing players to showcase their style and appreciation for the champion. However, the visual enhancements and attention to detail make it a worthwhile addition to any Pantheon player's collection.

Now, let's delve into the story of Pantheon himself. In the world of League of Legends, Pantheon is a warrior from the ancient empire of Targon. He was chosen by the celestial aspect known as Atreus to become the embodiment of war and battle. With his newfound powers, Pantheon became a champion of Targon, fighting in the name of his people and the celestial beings who granted him his abilities.

Pantheon's strengths lie in his ability to engage enemies and deal significant burst damage. His Q ability, Spear Shot, allows him to throw his spear at enemies, dealing damage and applying a critical hit if the target is below a certain health threshold. His W ability, Aegis Assault, grants him a shield and allows him to leap onto an enemy, stunning them and dealing damage in the process. Pantheon's E ability, Heartseeker Strike, is a powerful area-of-effect ability that damages all enemies in a cone in front of him. Finally, his ultimate ability, Grand Skyfall, allows him to leap into the air and land at a target location, damaging and slowing enemies in the area.

However, Pantheon also has weaknesses that players must be aware of. He is a melee champion, which means he is susceptible to kiting and crowd control effects. Additionally, Pantheon's abilities have relatively high cooldowns, making him vulnerable during the downtime between his rotations. Players must carefully manage their abilities and positioning to maximize Pantheon's effectiveness in combat.

In the world of League of Legends, Pantheon is often played in the top lane or jungle roles. His strong early game presence and ability to snowball make him a formidable force in the early stages of the game. Pantheon excels at roaming and making plays around the map, using his ultimate ability to surprise enemies and turn the tides of battle.

On this page, you can find information and videos showcasing all of Pantheon's appearances, including the Ashen Conqueror Pantheon skin. Whether you're a fan of his classic look or prefer the darker aesthetic of the Ashen Conqueror skin, there's something for everyone to enjoy.

Pantheon (Glaive Warrior Pantheon)

Cost: 1350 RP | Release Date: August 10, 2021

League of Legends is known for its vast array of champions, each with their own unique abilities and playstyles. One such champion is Pantheon, a fearsome warrior hailing from the ancient city of Targon. Pantheon has recently received a new skin called

which showcases his prowess in battle and adds a fresh look to his already impressive arsenal.

Glaive Warrior Pantheon is a 1350 RP skin that was released on August 10, 2021. This skin offers players a chance to experience Pantheon in a whole new light, with updated visuals and animations that truly bring out the essence of this mighty warrior.

Let's delve into the details of this skin and explore what makes it a must-have for any Pantheon enthusiast.

Design and Visuals

Glaive Warrior Pantheon is a skin that embodies the spirit of a battle-hardened warrior. Pantheon dons a set of intricately designed armor, adorned with sharp edges and intricate patterns. The skin features a color palette dominated by shades of gold and black, giving it a regal and imposing appearance.

One of the standout features of this skin is the glaive that Pantheon wields. The glaive itself is a work of art, with a long, curved blade and a detailed hilt. The weapon gleams with a golden hue, adding to the overall aesthetic of the skin. As Pantheon strikes his enemies with the glaive, players will notice the fluidity of his movements and the impact of each strike, thanks to the updated animations.

Additionally, Glaive Warrior Pantheon boasts new visual effects that enhance the overall experience. From the fiery trail left behind by Pantheon's ultimate ability, Grand Starfall, to the shimmering golden particles that accompany his abilities, every aspect of this skin has been carefully crafted to provide players with a visually stunning experience.

A Short Narrative: The Story of Pantheon

Pantheon, once a mortal man named Atreus, was chosen by the celestial aspect known as Atreus to become the embodiment of war and battle. With his newfound powers, Pantheon became a formidable warrior, fighting to protect the people of Targon from any threats that may arise.

Throughout his journey, Pantheon faced numerous challenges and encountered various adversaries. He became a symbol of strength and courage, inspiring others to stand up against injustice. Pantheon's unwavering determination and unyielding spirit made him a force to be reckoned with on the battlefield.

In the game, Pantheon is known for his versatility and ability to dominate both in the top lane and as a jungler. His kit revolves around dealing burst damage and engaging in close-quarters combat. With his Q ability, Spear Shot, Pantheon hurls his spear at his enemies, dealing damage and applying a stack of Mortal Will. Once Pantheon has accumulated enough stacks, he can activate his empowered abilities, granting him additional effects and increased damage.

However, Pantheon also has his weaknesses. He relies heavily on his abilities to deal damage, making him vulnerable if his abilities are on cooldown. Additionally, Pantheon's ultimate ability, Grand Starfall, requires careful positioning and timing to maximize its effectiveness, as it can be easily dodged by attentive opponents.

Despite his weaknesses, Pantheon remains a popular pick in the League of Legends community. His high burst damage and ability to initiate team fights make him a valuable asset to any team composition. Whether you prefer to play him as a bruiser in the top lane or as an aggressive jungler, Pantheon's versatility and strong early game presence make him a formidable opponent.

Pantheon (Prestige Ascended Pantheon)

RP Cost: 100 Prestige Points | Release Date: August 2021

League of Legends is known for its vast array of champions, each with their own unique abilities and captivating stories. One such champion is Pantheon, a formidable warrior who has recently received a stunning new skin called

This article will delve into the details of this prestigious costume, as well as provide an overview of Pantheon's story, strengths, weaknesses, and his significance in the game.

The Prestige Ascended Pantheon Skin

The Prestige Ascended Pantheon skin is a highly sought-after cosmetic item that allows players to showcase their dedication and skill. This skin is an exclusive variant of the base Ascended Pantheon skin, featuring enhanced visual effects, animations, and a unique color scheme. With its golden accents and intricate design, Prestige Ascended Pantheon truly stands out on the battlefield.

To obtain this prestigious skin, players must spend 100 Prestige Points, which can be earned through various in-game events or purchased directly from the League of Legends store. The skin was released in August 2021, adding a touch of grandeur to Pantheon's already impressive arsenal of appearances.

Pantheon's Story

Pantheon, also known as Atreus, is a warrior hailing from the war-torn region of Targon. He was once a mortal man, but after a fateful encounter with the celestial aspect known as the Aspect of War, he was chosen to become its vessel. Transformed into an immortal being, Pantheon now wields the power of the heavens, using his spear and shield to bring justice to the world.

Driven by a sense of duty and honor, Pantheon fights to protect the mortal realm from the threats that lurk within the celestial realm. He is a symbol of strength and resilience, embodying the ideals of war and valor. Pantheon's unwavering determination and unyielding spirit make him a formidable force on the battlefield.

Strengths and Weaknesses

Pantheon possesses a diverse set of strengths and weaknesses that players must consider when choosing him as their champion. His primary strength lies in his early game dominance. Pantheon excels at aggressive playstyles, utilizing his powerful abilities to harass and burst down opponents. His Q ability, Spear Shot, allows him to poke enemies from a distance, while his E ability, Aegis Assault, provides him with a shield and crowd control, making him difficult to kill.

Furthermore, Pantheon's ultimate ability, Grand Starfall, allows him to leap into the air and crash down at a target location, dealing damage and stunning enemies in the area. This global presence makes him a threat in team fights and enables him to quickly join skirmishes across the map.

However, Pantheon does have his weaknesses. As the game progresses, Pantheon's effectiveness diminishes, especially against tankier opponents. His abilities lack scaling, making him fall off in damage compared to other champions in the later stages of the game. Additionally, Pantheon heavily relies on his abilities, leaving him vulnerable if his abilities are on cooldown. Skilled opponents can exploit this weakness and capitalize on his temporary moments of weakness.

Pantheon's Place in the Game

Pantheon has been a staple pick in the top lane for many seasons. His early game dominance and ability to impact other lanes with his ultimate make him a valuable asset to any team. Pantheon's versatility allows him to be played as a bruiser or an assassin, adapting to different team compositions and strategies.

Furthermore, Pantheon's lore and character design have made him a fan-favorite among the League of Legends community. His story of sacrifice and his unwavering dedication to his cause resonate with players, making him an iconic champion within the game.

Pantheon (Zombie Slayer Pantheon)

League of Legends is known for its vast array of champions, each with their own unique abilities and appearances. Pantheon is a versatile champion who excels in the top lane and jungle roles, and his latest skin, Zombie Slayer Pantheon, adds a thrilling twist to his already impressive arsenal.

Zombie Slayer Pantheon is a skin that was released on October 20, 2016, and it quickly became a fan favorite. Priced at 1350 RP, this skin offers players a chance to embody the role of a zombie hunter, ready to take on the undead hordes with style and precision.

The skin features Pantheon clad in a rugged, post-apocalyptic outfit, complete with a tattered cape and a menacing helmet adorned with spikes. His spear is transformed into a deadly weapon, with a glowing green blade that pulsates with dark energy. Now, let's delve into the lore and story behind Pantheon and how he fits into the world of League of Legends. Pantheon, also known as Atreus, was once a mortal warrior who fought alongside his comrades in the Rakkor tribe. The Rakkor are a group of fierce warriors who reside in the towering peak of Mount Targon, a sacred place believed to be the bridge between the mortal realm and the celestial realm.

Driven by a desire to protect his people and prove his worth, Pantheon sought the blessings of the Aspects, celestial beings who grant power to chosen mortals. He climbed Mount Targon and faced the Aspect of War, Atreus, in a brutal battle. In the end, Pantheon emerged victorious, but at a cost. He became the new Aspect of War, merging his essence with that of the fallen Aspect.

As the Aspect of War, Pantheon gained incredible strength, agility, and combat prowess. He became the embodiment of war itself, wielding his spear with deadly precision and leading his fellow Rakkor warriors into battle. Pantheon's ultimate ability, Grand Skyfall, allows him to leap into the air and crash down on his enemies, dealing massive damage and creating chaos on the battlefield.

However, Pantheon's story doesn't end there. In the alternate universe of Zombie Slayer Pantheon, the world has been overrun by hordes of undead creatures. Pantheon, ever the warrior, takes it upon himself to eradicate the zombie menace and restore peace to the land. Armed with his trusty spear and unwavering determination, he becomes the ultimate Zombie Slayer.

With his Zombie Slayer Pantheon skin, players can experience the thrill of battling the undead as this iconic champion. Whether you're a fan of the zombie genre or simply enjoy the unique aesthetic of this skin, Zombie Slayer Pantheon offers a refreshing twist on Pantheon's classic appearance.

Pantheon (Pulsefire Pantheon)

RP Cost: 1350 RP

Release Date: August 27, 2020

Pulsefire Pantheon is a futuristic skin that brings a whole new level of style and power to the champion Pantheon in League of Legends. Released on August 27, 2020, this skin is priced at 1350 RP, offering players a visually stunning and immersive experience.

The Pulsefire Pantheon skin transforms the Spartan warrior into a high-tech, time-traveling hero. With sleek armor, glowing blue accents, and a futuristic spear, Pantheon becomes a force to be reckoned with on the battlefield. The skin features unique animations, sound effects, and visual effects that truly bring the Pulsefire theme to life.

One of the standout features of the Pulsefire Pantheon skin is the ability to transform into different versions of Pantheon as the game progresses. As Pantheon levels up, he gains access to new forms, each with its own distinct appearance and abilities. This adds an extra layer of excitement and variety to the gameplay, as players can adapt their strategy based on the form they are currently in.

Here are the different forms that Pulsefire Pantheon can take:

  • Pulsefire Pantheon (Base Form): This is the default form of Pulsefire Pantheon. With his futuristic armor and spear, Pantheon is ready to take on any challenge.
  • Pulsefire Pantheon (Level 6 Form): At level 6, Pantheon gains a new form with enhanced abilities. His armor becomes more advanced, and his spear gains additional power.
  • Pulsefire Pantheon (Level 11 Form): At level 11, Pantheon evolves once again, becoming even more formidable. His armor becomes sleeker and more streamlined, and his spear radiates with energy.
  • Pulsefire Pantheon (Level 16 Form): At level 16, Pantheon reaches his final form. He becomes a true embodiment of the Pulsefire theme, with intricate armor and a spear that crackles with electricity.

With each form, Pulsefire Pantheon gains new visual effects and abilities, making him a visually striking and powerful champion to play. Whether you prefer the base form or enjoy the evolution of his appearance, Pulsefire Pantheon offers a unique and exciting experience for players.

Now, let's delve into the story of Pantheon and his place in the League of Legends universe.

Pantheon: The Artisan of War

Pantheon is a champion known for his strength, agility, and unwavering determination. Hailing from the war-torn region of Targon, Pantheon is a warrior who fights for justice and honor. Clad in his iconic Spartan armor, he wields a spear with deadly precision, making him a formidable opponent on the battlefield.

In the world of League of Legends, Pantheon is a versatile champion who excels in the top lane. His kit is designed to engage enemies, deal burst damage, and disrupt team fights. With his Q ability, Spear Shot, Pantheon hurls his spear at his enemies, dealing damage and applying a critical hit if the target is below a certain health threshold. His W ability, Aegis Assault, allows him to leap to a target and unleash a flurry of strikes, blocking incoming damage. Pantheon's E ability, Heartseeker Strike, is a powerful area-of-effect ability that damages all enemies in a cone in front of him. Finally, his ultimate ability, Grand Starfall, allows him to leap into the air and crash down at a target location, damaging and slowing enemies in the area.

Pantheon's lore is deeply intertwined with the celestial beings of Targon. In his original lore, Pantheon was a mortal who ascended to become the Aspect of War, a divine entity chosen by the celestial powers of Targon. However, with the introduction of the new Pantheon rework, his lore has been updated. Now, Pantheon is Atreus, a mortal warrior who wields the power of the Aspect of War. He fights alongside the celestial Aspect, channeling their power to bring justice to the world.

As for Pulsefire Pantheon, this skin offers a unique twist to Pantheon's story. In this alternate universe, Pantheon has become a time-traveling hero, donning advanced armor and wielding futuristic weaponry. The Pulsefire theme adds a new layer of depth to Pantheon's character, showcasing his adaptability and versatility.

On this page, you can find information and videos about all the appearances of Pantheon, including his base skin and other available skins. Whether you prefer the classic Spartan look or the futuristic style of Pulsefire Pantheon, there is a skin to suit every player's taste.

So, gear up and step into the shoes of Pantheon, the Artisan of War. Unleash your power, dominate the battlefield, and become a legend in the world of League of Legends.

Pantheon: The Unbreakable Spear

Release Date: February 2, 2010

As one of the oldest champions in League of Legends, Pantheon has become an iconic figure on the battlefield. With his unwavering determination and unparalleled combat skills, he has carved his name into the annals of history. This article delves into the story, strengths, weaknesses, and overall significance of Pantheon in the game.

The Story of Pantheon

Pantheon hails from the war-torn region of Mount Targon, a place where only the strongest and most resilient warriors survive. Born Atreus, he was a simple baker's son who dreamed of becoming a legendary warrior. His dreams were realized when he encountered the celestial aspect of war, Atreus willingly gave up his mortal life to become the embodiment of war itself.

Now known as Pantheon, he wields the mighty spear, Aegis, and dons the unbreakable armor of the Rakkor tribe. His purpose is to protect Mount Targon and its people from any threats that may arise. Pantheon's unwavering loyalty and dedication to his cause make him a formidable force on the battlefield.

Strengths and Weaknesses

Pantheon's kit is designed to excel in the early game, allowing him to dominate his opponents and establish an early advantage. His passive ability, Mortal Will, empowers his next basic ability after casting four spells or basic attacks, granting bonus effects and increased damage. This allows Pantheon to unleash devastating combos and burst down his enemies.

His Q ability, Spear Shot, is a skillshot that deals damage to the first enemy hit. It can be used to poke enemies from a distance or secure last hits on minions. Pantheon's W ability, Aegis Assault, allows him to leap towards an enemy, stunning them and blocking incoming basic attacks. This ability is crucial for engaging in fights and locking down priority targets.

Pantheon's E ability, Heartseeker Strike, is an area-of-effect ability that deals damage in a cone in front of him. It can be used to clear minion waves quickly or deal damage to multiple enemies in team fights. His ultimate ability, Grand Skyfall, is a global presence ability that allows Pantheon to leap into the air and land at a target location, damaging and slowing enemies in the area.

While Pantheon excels in the early game, he can struggle in the late game when other champions start to scale and become more powerful. His abilities are primarily focused on burst damage, making him less effective against tankier opponents. Additionally, Pantheon lacks mobility, making him vulnerable to crowd control and kiting.

Pantheon's Place in the Game

Pantheon is primarily played in the top lane, where his early game dominance can give him a significant advantage over his opponents. His ability to roam with his ultimate also makes him a threat in other lanes, allowing him to assist his teammates and secure objectives across the map.

His playstyle revolves around aggressive early game strategies, such as constantly harassing the enemy laner and looking for opportunities to engage in all-ins. Pantheon players must have a good understanding of their champion's power spikes and capitalize on them to snowball the game in their favor.

Furthermore, Pantheon's lore and character design have made him a fan-favorite among the League of Legends community. His stoic and unwavering personality, combined with his visually striking appearance, have cemented his place as one of the most recognizable champions in the game.

Pantheon's journey from a humble baker's son to the embodiment of war is a testament to his unwavering determination and unyielding spirit. With his iconic spear and unbreakable armor, he stands as a symbol of strength and resilience. Whether you seek to dominate the top lane or simply appreciate his lore and character, Pantheon is a champion that continues to leave a lasting impact on the world of League of Legends.
